about_the_game:
Blind Exposure is a horror exploration game from a first person perspective with a unique scanning mechanic. Your goal is to find the beast lurking in the abandoned facility, explore the building and survive.

You find yourself in an abandoned facility. You were sent here with only one goal - find the beast roaming free and contain it, before it gets out and wreaks havoc. But remember - you're the one trapped with the monster, and you need to survive at all costs.
Use your scanner to illuminate a completely dark environment, explore the facility in search of the beast and survive.

Use your scanner


The beast you search for hunts those, who stare at it - that's why your eyes have been replaced with a scanning device, increasing your chances for survival, but limiting your vision.
Use your scanner to illuminate a completely dark world, but remember - scans you take are just still frames showing the state of the environment at the moment of taking the scan; everything around could have already changed.

Go Deeper

The facility you're in reaches deeper than you think. To find the beast you will need to explore many levels of the building. Venture deeper and deeper, explore forgotten spaces, find secrets and uncover the truth behind the facility.

Find it first

No matter how deep you go, you will feel the presence of the beast lurking in the darkness. You need to find it and contain it. But don't get it wrong - you're the one trapped with the monster. Don't get caught, survive at all costs and overcome the fear.

  • Processor: Intel Core i3
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Intel Graphics 4000
  • Storage: 3 GB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Core i5
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVidia GeForce 2060 RTX

short_description: Navigate through claustrophobic, completely dark world illuminated only by scans you manage to create; listen carefully to sounds coming from the darkness, and don’t let dread and paranoia get to you.
